org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports

Class NiReportsEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.NiReportsEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IdsAcceptorsBuilder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NiReportsEngineForTesting

    public class NiReportsEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements IdsAcceptorsBuilder
    The NiReports engine API-independent entrypoint. A single report should be run per instance
    No schema-specific code below this point.
    Code can change its APIs at any point below this point - using the AMP Reports API here is entirely optional
    Because instances of this class are the root of the objects tree and are accessible throughtout the schema, its state is generously exposed as public fields. It's a tradeoff between architectural beauty and workable simplicity.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.runtime.IdsAcceptorsBuilder

      • actualColumns

        public java.util.LinkedHashSet<java.lang.String> actualColumns
        all the columns which are used in the actually-run report. Some of them might have been added virtually (like for example as a dependency of a measure, filter or an another column)

      • actualMeasures

        public java.util.LinkedHashSet<java.lang.String> actualMeasures
        all the measures which are used in the actually-run report. Some of them might have been added virtually (like for example as a dependency of a measure)

      • reportRunMeasures

        public java.util.LinkedHashSet<java.lang.String> reportRunMeasures
        the measures which should be run in the report (e.g. ones requested by the spec + the ones requested by NiReportMeasure.getPrecursorMeasures[value = true])

      • actualHierarchies

        public java.util.LinkedHashSet<java.lang.String> actualHierarchies
        all the hierarchies which are used in the actually-run report. Some of them might have been added virtually (like for example as a dependency of a filter).
        This is fully included in actualColumns, else it's a bug

      • output

        protected void output()
        does the last-stage postprocessing before exiting, e.g. eliminating undisplayable columns from the output
        Right now this is year-range-settings; once computed measures have been implemented this will also be eliminating the unrequested dependencies. Also virtual hierarchies generated by filters will be eliminated here
